Class Player

java.lang.Object
  Player

public class Player
extends java.lang.Object

The Player class creates a new player and stores their name, prizes they have won, total value of their prizes won, and how much money they have spent. It is used by the PlayerList class to store information relevant to the current player as well as a list of Player objects.

Version:
1.6 27 May 2015
Author:
Bai Chan Kheo 22262407

Parameters:

Returns:

addSpent

public boolean addSpent(int newSpent)
This method adds the cost of the player's guess to the total amount that the player has spent.

Parameters:
newSpent - The cost of the Prize object guessed.
Returns:
True if spent amount is added successfully.

addWorth

public boolean addWorth(int newWorth)
This method adds a prize's worth to the total worth off all the player's prizes.

Parameters:
newWorth - The worth of the Prize object won.
Returns:
True if the prize's worth had been added successfully.
